(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

maintainer delegate
bors d+

```suggestion
    âˆ€ {a b} {lâ‚ lâ‚‚}, l = lâ‚ ++ (a :: b :: lâ‚‚) â†’ R a b := by
```

or even
```suggestion
    âˆ€ â¦ƒa b lâ‚ lâ‚‚â¦„, l = lâ‚ ++ a :: b :: lâ‚‚ â†’ R a b := by
```

Here's a slightly golfed version of the proof.
```suggestion
  refine âŸ¨fun h _ _ _ _ eq => (chain'_append_cons_cons.mp (eq â–¸ h)).2.1, ?_âŸ©
  induction l with
  | nil => exact fun _ â†¦ chain'_nil
  | cons head tail ih =>
    match tail with
    | nil => exact fun _ â†¦ chain'_singleton head
    | cons head' tail =>
      refine fun h â†¦ chain'_cons.mpr âŸ¨h (nil_append _).symm, ih @(fun a b lâ‚ lâ‚‚ eq => ?_)âŸ©
      simpa [eq] using @h (lâ‚ := head :: lâ‚) (lâ‚‚ := lâ‚‚)
```

I think "forall" is used more often than "all" to denote `âˆ€` in theorem names. 

One possible name would be `chain'_iff_forall_rel_of_append_cons_cons` - maybe @YaelDillies has suggestions for a better name?
I think this is a hard one to name, but your name is better than the current one, yes
Can you start multiline statements on a newline?

Hint:
```suggestion
âˆ€ {a b} {lâ‚ lâ‚‚}, l = lâ‚ ++ (a :: b :: lâ‚‚) â†’ R a b where
  mp h _ _ _ _ eq := (chain'_append_cons_cons.mp (eq â–¸ h)).2.1
```
You didn't apply this comment
yes, the golfed version of Paul-Lez used already a refine, so they both address this point

```suggestion
    Chain' R l â†” âˆ€ â¦ƒa b lâ‚ lâ‚‚â¦„, l = lâ‚ ++ a :: b :: lâ‚‚ â†’ R a b := by
```
will be less painful
